intro: Zieria pilosa var. canescens, commonly known as the silver-haired zieria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridaceae and is characterized by its small, dense clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and coastal environments, often in well-drained sandy soils. Its foliage is covered in fine, silver-white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, leathery leaves.
